symptoms.second: Persistent or severe headaches, often behind the eyes.
Blurred vision, loss of peripheral vision, or double vision.
Feeling tired or lacking energy.
Changes in menstruation, libido, or growth in children.
Especially in the morning or with changes in posture.

cures.second: Hormone replacement or medication to shrink the tumor.
Surgical removal of the tumor, if necessary.
Targeted radiation to destroy tumor cells.
Regular monitoring and follow-up with a healthcare provider.
Supplemental hormones to manage hormonal imbalances.

prevention.second: Regular visits to a healthcare provider for screenings.
Maintain a healthy diet and exercise regularly.
Stress reduction techniques, such as meditation or yoga.
Learn about symptoms and warning signs of pituitary disorders.
Follow prescribed medication schedules and dosages.

symptoms.second: Persistent or severe headaches, often worsened in the morning.
Sudden, uncontrolled movements or changes in consciousness.
Especially in the morning or with changes in posture.
Blurry vision, double vision, or visual field deficits.
Mood swings, behavioral changes, or cognitive decline.

cures.second: Surgical removal of the tumor, if possible.
High-dose radiation to target and shrink the tumor.
Systemic medications to kill cancer cells.
Medications targeting specific molecular pathways.
Palliative care for symptom management and comfort.

prevention.second: Avoid exposure to radiation or carcinogenic substances.
Maintain a balanced diet and exercise regularly.
Monitoring for any neurological symptoms or changes.
Control seizures with appropriate medications.
Psychosocial support for patients and caregivers.
